guide.title: Gentoo/MIPS Linux
guide.abstract: The Gentoo/MIPS Project provides the Gentoo GNU/Linux operating system for mips-based platforms.

body.p: Gentoo/MIPS is a port of the Gentoo GNU/Linux and the Gentoo Portage package management system to mips-based platforms. Primary focus is on the Silicon Graphics (SGI) line of mips-based workstations, specifically the Indy and Indigo2. Work is also underway for Gentoo/MIPS support on SGI O2 systems and hopefuly in the future, Gentoo/MIPS will expand to Cobalt mips-based systems as well.

All current Gentoo/MIPS developers will be listed here with responsibilities, contact information, etc. (Note: Full/Part Time only indicates how much of the developer's Gentoo time is spent on this project.)

tr.ti: Kernel sources/headers, Documentation, Netboot Images, Stage Building, General Porting

chapter.title: Installation Guide, Mailing Lists, & IRC Channel

body.p: Those interested in running Gentoo/MIPS on an SGI mips-based system can get started by reading the Installation Guide. Help can be obtained by subscribing to the gentoo-mips mailing list. More information about subscribing to a Gentoo mailing list can be found on the Mailing Lists page.
Those with access to an IRC Client can join #gentoo-mips on irc.freenode.net for general questions, help, or just to talk with others using Gentoo/MIPS.
